resource.name: High Cost Disbursements
resource.description: This dataset provides information about total dollars disbursed to Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the High Cost Program by month and year since January 2003.
columns_description: State abbreviation for carrier receiving High Cost support.
FCC Form 498 ID (also called a Service Provider Identification Number or SPIN) is a unique nine-digit number assigned to a service provider by USAC when the service provider files an FCC Form 498.
Individual High Cost fund in which the carrier participates. See High Cost Funds Glossary for details.
Amount of funding disbursed to carriers. The “amount disbursed” may occasionally show a negative number. This is a result of prior period adjustments, audit recoveries, or other factors.
Year of disbursement to carrier.
Standard name used to identify a study area. Typically, the study area name is the same as the carrier name.
Month of disbursement to carrier.
Unique number assigned to each ETC based on its service area. A carrier with multiple service areas within a single state will have multiple SAC.

domain_tags: connect america fund broadband loop support
connect america fund phase ii auction

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides information about total dollars disbursed to Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the High Cost Program by month and year since January 2003. Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What disbursements has an ETC received from USAC? What type of High Cost support does each state receive?

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

resource.name: Lifeline Companies Near Me
resource.description: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline and Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline or ACP service in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.
columns_description: Zip code of the area where the carrier provides service.
State where a Study Area Code (SAC) is designated.
URL of the carrier’s website.
Customer service phone number of the carrier.
City of the area where the carrier provides service.
A provider offers one or more plans that are covered in full by the ACP discount and by choosing one of those plans your monthly cost for service is $0.
Full legal name of the carrier.

Type of service provided by the carrier. It may be wireless or wireline for service offered through the Lifeline Program. It may be ACP Home Internet or ACP Mobile Internet for service offered through the ACP.

Eligible households can also receive a one-time discount of up to $100 to purchase a laptop, desktop computer, or tablet from participating providers if they contribute more than $10 and less than $50 toward the purchase price.
County of the area where the carrier provides service.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL for a particular zip code. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% to 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that users left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

resource.name: Emergency Connectivity Fund FCC Form 471
resource.description: This dataset contains data from each Emergency Connectivity Fund (ECF) FCC Form 471 including applicant details such as applicant type, Billed Entity Number (BEN), student count, dollars requested and approved, as well as related information from the ECF portal;  data from each Funding Request Number (FRN) including service provider and contract information, Funding Commitment Decision Letter (FCDL) related data, and invoicing details; and data from each FRN line item ID including individual product/service data, costs, quantities, and descriptions.
columns_name: Unmet Student Needs 12 (After ECF funding will lack access to device and connection)
Unmet Student Needs 3 (At start of pandemic lacked access to device and connection)
Unmet Student Needs 11 (After ECF funding will lack access to connection)
Unmet Student Needs 4 (During 2020-2021 provided access to device)
Unmet Student Needs 2 (At start of pandemic lacked access to connection)
FRN Recipients of Service (ROS) Entity Data
Unmet Student Needs 10 (After ECF funding will lack access to device)
Unmet Student Needs 9 (With ECF funding will provide access to device and connection)
Unmet Student Needs 8 (With ECF funding will provide access to connection)
Unmet Student Needs 7 (With ECF funding will provide access to device)
Unmet Student Needs 6 (During 2020-2021 provided access to device and connection)
Unmet Student Needs 5 (During 2020-2021 provided access to connection)
FRN Total Count of Recipients of Service
Line Item ID Months of Service
Unmet Student Needs 1 (At start of pandemic lacked access to device)
columns_description: Total monthly recurring charges for the FRN line item ID.
Urban/rural status of the billed entity.
Agreement type for the FRN including non-contracted, contract or tariff.
Student count for the billed entity based on the entity profile.

Total monthly recurring charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at the FRN level to generate metrics across service type, status or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line item ID level.

Total charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at the FRN level to generate metrics across service type, status or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line item ID level.
Funding request line item ID number. This is the lowest level of detail of this dataset.
Model of the product on FRN line item ID.
Internet download speed of the connection for the FRN line item ID as megabits per second (Mbps).
Internet upload speed of the connection for the FRN line item ID as megabits per second (Mbps).
Unit quantity for the one-time costs for the FRN line item ID.
Billed entity number for the ECF FCC Form 471 applicant.
For consortium or ESA school district billed entities, the total count of selected members in the application.
Ten-digit number that the FCC assigns to a business or individual that registers with the FCC.
Services must be installed or product must be delivered on or before this date.
Status of the funding request. It includes pending, funded, denied or cancelled.

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: Even after receiving the funding that you are requesting from the Emergency Connectivity Fund Program, how many students in your school or school district will lack access to both a connected device and a broadband connection that is sufficient to engage in remote learning?
When the selected service type is services with new construction or self-provisioned network, this is the network equipment make and model for the FRN line item ID.
When the selected service type is services, indicates if firewall services are included in the FRN line item ID.
When the selected service type is equipment, this is the product type for the FRN line item ID. Examples include: laptops, routers, wi-fi hotspots, etc.

Total one-time/non-recurring charge of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at the FRN level to generate metrics across service type, status or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line item ID level.

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: At the start of the pandemic, how many students in your school or school district lacked access to both a connected device and a broadband connection that were sufficient to engage in remote learning?
FRN service type including equipment and services.
Current status of the ECF FCC Form 471. It can be used to filter the following statuses: Certified and Committed.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.

Total approved amount for a funding request. This field can be aggregated at the FRN level to generate metrics across service type, status or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line item ID level.
Exact date and time the ECF FCC Form 471 was last modified (EST).

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: Even after receiving the funding that you are requesting from the Emergency Connectivity Fund Program, how many students in your school or school district will lack access to a broadband connection that is sufficient to engage in remote learning?

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: During the 2020-2021 school year, how many students in your school or school district did you provide a connected device, because they otherwise would not have had a connected device that was sufficient to engage in remote learning?

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: At the start of the pandemic, how many students in your school or school district lacked access to a broadband connection that was sufficient to engage in remote learning?
Applicant street address.
Applicant zip code.
The date of the obligation file that a funding commitment was issued in.
Indicates whether the application has been certified during the ECF FCC Form 471 application filing window.
Link to download the original submitted ECF FCC Form 471 as a PDF.

For consortium or ESA school district billed entities, the entity data of the selected recipients of service (ROS) on the FRN. The ROS entity data includes entity number, name, entity type, city, and state. If multiple ROS entities are selected in one application, then the entity data is concatenated as a nested array: {Entity Number1| Name1| Entity Type1| City1| State1}, {Entity Number2|Name2| Entity Type2| City2| State2}.
One-time costs per unit for the FRN line item ID.
When the selected service type is services with new construction or self-provisioned network, this is the network equipment type for the FRN line item ID.
Estimated end date of services on ECF FCC Form 471 application. Service end date may impact commitment amount as it could adjust the month of services.
Unique nine-digit number assigned to identify the service provider. If null, the service provided has not registered in the E-rate program.
Funding request amount for applicant across all FRNs.

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: Even after receiving the funding that you are requesting from the Emergency Connectivity Fund Program, how many students in your school or school district will lack access to a connected device that is sufficient to engage in remote learning?

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: With the funding you are requesting from the Emergency Connectivity Fund Program, how many students in your school or school district will you provide with both a connected device and a broadband connection, because they otherwise would not have had a connected device or a broadband connection that was sufficient to engage in remote learning?

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: With the funding you are requesting from the Emergency Connectivity Fund Program, how many students in your school or school district will you provide with a broadband connection, because they otherwise would not have had a broadband connection that was sufficient to engage in remote learning?

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: With the funding you are requesting from the Emergency Connectivity Fund Program, how many students in your school or school district will you provide with a connected device, because they would otherwise not have a connected device that is sufficient to engage in remote learning?

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: During the 2020-2021 school year, how many students in your school or school district did you provide both a connected device and a broadband connection, because they otherwise would not have had a connected device or a broadband connection that was sufficient to engage in remote learning?

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: During the 2020-2021 school year, how many students in your school or school district did you provide a broadband connection, because they otherwise would not have had a broadband connection that was sufficient to engage in remote learning?

Consulting firm entity data associated with the application's billed entity. The consulting firm entity data includes name and the consultant's registration number (CRN) assigned by USAC. If multiple consulting firms are associated with one application, then the entity data is concatenated as a nested array: {Name1| CRN1}, {Name2| CRN2}.
Email address of the main contact provided by the applicant on the ECF FCC Form 471. This contact is used as the first point of contact through the funding request process.
Phone number of the main contact provided by the applicant on the ECF FCC Form 471.
Full name of the main contact provided by the applicant on the ECF FCC Form 471.
The applicant subtype (or subtypes separated by commas if multiple). Examples include: public school, private school, research library, bookmobile, Tribal school, Tribal library, etc.
Applicant city.
Last date an Invoice (BEAR or SPI) can be received.
Identifies the ECF filing window for the application.
Applicant type including school, school district, library, library system, or consortium.
Name of the applicant's organization (also referred to as the billed entity).
Nickname given to an ECF FCC Form 471 by an applicant.
Unique application number generated at the time an applicant begins to file the ECF FCC Form 471 application. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Total costs for the FRN line item ID.
Total FRN approved authorized disbursement amount that will be paid to the service provider or applicant.
Total one-time charges for the FRN line item ID.
Unit quantity for the FRN line item ID monthly recurring costs.
Monthly recurring costs per unit for the FRN line item ID.
When the selected service type is services, this is the connection type for the FRN line item ID. Examples include: leased lit fiber, cable modem, mobile broadband etc.
Explanation of FCDL decision at the FRN level. MR: modification reason; CR: cancellation reason; DR: denial reason.
For consortium or ESA school district billed entities, the count of recipients of service in the FRN.
Estimated start date of services on ECF FCC Form 471 application. Service start date may impact commitment amount as it could adjust the month of services.
Service provider name for the FRN.
Nickname given to an FRN from the ECF FCC Form 471 by an applicant.
Unique funding request number associated with the ECF FCC Form 471.
Exact date and time (EST) when the ECF FCC Form 471 was certified.
Type of invoice to be processed for FRN including "Applicant - FCC Form 472 (BEAR Form)" and "Service Provider - FCC Form 474 (SPI Form)".
Narrative for the FRN describing the products and services.
A number that indicates in which obligation file the funding commitment was issued in.
Number of months of service entered for the FRN line item ID.
Applicant state.

Indicates if an FRN includes a request for funding for new construction, a self-provisioned network, and/or datacasting equipment. This does not include monthly recurring costs for either a leased lit fiber service or wireless services.
Applicant zip code extension.

For consortium or ESA school district billed entities, the entity data of the selected members on the application. The member entity data includes BEN, name, entity type, total student count, total square footage, and urban/rural status. If multiple member entities are selected in one application, then the entity data is concatenated as a nested array: {BEN1| Name1| Entity Type1| Total Student Count1| Total Square Footage1| Urban/ Rural Status1}, {BEN2| Name2| Entity Type2| Total Student Count2| Total Square Footage2| Urban/ Rural Status2}

Count of students provided by applicant in response to the application question: At the start of the pandemic, how many students in your school or school district lacked access to a connected device (laptop or tablet) that was sufficient to engage in remote learning?
Manufacturer of the FRN line item ID product.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains data from each Emergency Connectivity Fund (ECF) FCC Form 471 including applicant details such as applicant type, Billed Entity Number (BEN), student count, dollars requested and approved, as well as related information from the ECF portal;  data from each Funding Request Number (FRN) including service provider and contract information, Funding Commitment Decision Letter (FCDL) related data, and invoicing details; and data from each FRN line item ID including individual product/service data, costs, quantities, and descriptions. Use this dataset to answer questions about the applicant entity, the services requested, the quantity of the service requested, which service provider is supplying the service, the invoicing method used, the length of the contract, and fiber type information if applicable. All information within the ECF FCC Form 471 dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information from the basic information section of each FCC Form 470, including applicant details such as contact information, application number, Billed Entity Number (BEN), and funding year, and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).  Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What is the contact information of the applicant? Who is the technical contact for the applicant? When was the applicant’s FCC Form 470 certified? All data contained within the Basic Information (FCC Form 470) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: FRN Status (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_name: FCDL Comment for FCC Form 471 Application
FRN Total Pre-Discount Eligible Recurring Cost
FRN Total Monthly Recurring Ineligible Costs
Award based on State Master Contract

FRN Total Pre-Discount Eligible One-Time Costs
columns_description: The date the contract was awarded by the applicant to service provider.
Fiber type for fiber FRNs including Lit Fiber, Dark Fiber, or Self Provisioned Fiber.
Reference to a local law or contract to support pricing confidentiality requests.
Narrative for the FRN describing the products and services.
Indicates whether an FCC Form 470 was posted for the services/products associated with the FRN.
Number of months a service is provided during a funding year for an FRN based on the service start date and end date.

Total one-time/non-recurring charge of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.
Average cost of cabling, infrastructure, and associated hardware divided by the total project plant route feet.
Service start date from the approved FCC Form 486. Further updates to the service start date are not reflected in this field.
Explanation of FCDL decision at the form level. MR: management reason; CR: cancelled reason; DR: denial reason.
Funding Request Number from a previous fund year that is related to the FRN.
Fiber subtypes for fiber FRNs.  Options include maintenance and operation, network equipment, network equipment and maintenance, or special construction.
Explanation for the funding request decision made for a post commitment transaction.

Form status for the FCC Form 486 including:- Approved: FCC Form 486 and FRN is approved so invoicing may begin- Partially Approved: FCC Form 486 and FRN is partially approved so invoicing may begin for those FRNs approved.
Indicates if an FCC Form 473 Service Provider Annual Certification (SPAC) was filed for the Funding Year associated with the FCC Form 471.
Status of the funding request. It includes pending, funded, denied or cancelled.
Indicates whether FRN is for leased dark fiber or IRU (Indefensible Right of Use).

Funding source when the applicant is seeking a state match for fiber FRNs.  The E-rate program will provide additional Category One funding (up to 10%) to match state funding for special construction to connect schools and libraries to high-speed broadband services that meet the FCC's long-term capacity broadband goals.

Explanation of FCDL decision at the FRN level. MR: management reason; CR: cancelled
reason; DR: denial reason.
Program provides 1 to 1 dollar match amount in extra Category One fiber special construction funding up to an additional ten percent discount.
Amount financed for fiber FRNs.
Unique # assigned to the FCC Form 486
The date of the wave that a funding commitment was issued in.
Indicates whether the contact has voluntary extensions that can be exercised by the applicant for the FRN.
FCC Form 470 application number for the FRN submitted in EPC (FY2016 and later).

Current start date of services on FCC Form 471. Updates to the service start date will be reflected in this field. Service start dates impact commitment amounts because they adjust the months of services.
Total pre-discounted eligible recurring charges of a funding request. It is derived by multiplying the month of service and the pre-discounted monthly recurring charges.
Total ineligible one-time costs for the FRN level.

Total pre-discount charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.

A number that indicates which appeal wave the revised funding decision was issued in.
Total amount disbursed to a service provider or applicant.
Billing account number for the billed entity.
Number of months left on the contract for the FRN.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.

Total pre-discount ineligible monthly recurring charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.

Contract expiration date for the FRN. If the FRN is for a tariff or month-to-month service this field displays the service end date. This field can be used to filter the 471 applications that have active contracts.
Indicates whether the FRN pricing must be kept confidential and not disclosed to the public.

Contract number for the FRN. It can used to filter records related to a specific contract number.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions about the individual service type, the quantity of the service requested, which service provider is supplying the service, the length of the contract, the discount of the services received and fiber type information if applicable. All data contained within the FRN information data collection (FCC Form 471) is self-reported by applicants to the E-rate Program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: Rural Health Care Commitments and Disbursements (FCC Form 462/466/466A)
resource.description: This dataset contains data about funding decisions, total committed amounts, and total disbursement amounts for the Rural Health Care (RHC) Program. The data is collected from the FCC Form 462 (Funding Request Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF)), FCC Form 466 (Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program) and FCC Form 466A (Internet Service Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program). All information within the FCC Forms 462, 466, and 466A data collection is self-reported by applicants.
columns_description: Name of the Participating HCP receiving services.
Indicates the Entity Type receiving service.
Street address where Participating HCP site is located.
State where Participating HCP site is located.
Participating HCP County
Zip code where Participating HCP site is located.
System-generated longitude of the Participating HCP site address associated with the service request.
Indicates the category of expense (e.g. leased/tariffed facilities or services, network equipment) for which the funding is requested. Not applicable for the Telecommunications program.
Bandwidth speed requested by applicant.  Bandwidth field will be used for all Telecom applicants, and for HCF applicant only if the bandwidth (upload/download) requested is symmetrical.
Download speed requested by an HCF Program applicant. If “NA,” then relates to service where bandwidth is not applicable, e.g., network equipment.
Upload speed requested by an HCF Program applicant. If “NA,” then relates to service where bandwidth is not applicable, e.g., network equipment.

Number of service providers that bid on the request for services. A blank field means “not applicable” either because the information is not currently available from the applicant, .e.g., for Telecommunications program requests, or because the applicant claimed a competitive bidding exemption under the HCF Program.  Zero means no bids were received.

Indicates if the applicant is seeking a multi-year funding commitment in the HCF Program. However, applicants seeking support for $10,000 or less of annual undiscounted cost are not eligible for multi-year funding commitments. Not applicable for the Telecommunications program.

Portion of a connection that is eligible for support. When a connection is used by both eligible and ineligible sites, an applicant needs to indicate the portion of usage that is eligible for support.
Indicates if the HCP site is eligible for support. Each HCP site or location is considered an individual HCP for the purposes of calculating support.
Number of items an applicant is requesting. Not applicable for the Telecommunications program.
Monthly rural rate for the service.  Only applicable to Telecommunications program funding requests.
Monthly urban rate for the service.  Only applicable to Telecommunications program funding requests.
Date the funding starts.
Date the funding terminates.
Date the funding request was committed.
Date the funding request was submitted.

A unique nine-digit number assigned to a service provider by USAC when the service provider files an FCC Form 498. Every service provider is required to have a 498 ID in order to participate in any universal service program and/or receive payments from USAC.
Full legal name of a service provider.
Percentage of each qualifying funding request that will be approved for commitment.
The original amount an applicant requests with their FCC Form 462, 466, 466A.
The original amount that USAC will provide for the funding request.
Total amount USAC will provide for the funding request.
Dollars to date paid out by USAC for the funding request.
Indicates the guaranteed availability (as a percentage) of end-to-end network functionality.
Indicates the difference in the end-to-end delay (latency) between received packets of an IP or packet stream.
Indicates, in milliseconds, the delay between sending and receiving a packet.
Funding year for the application. The RHC funding year runs from July 1 to June 30.
Indicates whether the applicant reported Service Level Agreement on the block 28 of Form 462.
Filing window information associated with submitted funding requests.
Street address where Filing HCP is located.

Indicates the frequency of expense for the service an applicant is requesting. The applicant may specify the frequency as month, quarter, one-time, or year. This field defaults to "Month" for the Telecommunications program.
Indicates the last day to submit invoice(s) to USAC.
Service type for which the funding is requested.
System-generated latitude for the Participating HCP site address associated with the service request.
City where Participating HCP site is located.

FRN line number can be used to filter the records associated with a specific FRN, i.e., the FRN Line Number helps to identify a particular record when there are multiple record entries associated with the same FRN, which can occur with HCF Program requests. If field states “unallocated,” then support is not yet allocated to a specific site.
Indicates whether the funding request is for an individual health care provider (HCP) or a consortium. This field defaults to 'Individual' for the Telecommunications program.
Indicates the percentage of packets that are dropped or discarded before reaching their destination.
Indicates the Entity Type filling for service.
RHC is comprised of two programs: Health Care Connect Fund (HCF) and Telecommunications program. This field specifies which program the applicant applied for.
Status of FCC Forms 462, 466, and 466A. Only approved FCC Forms are currently displayed in this dataset.

A unique number assigned by USAC for each funding request submitted through FCC Forms 462, 466, and 466A. It can be used as a primary reference to extract additional information related to the funding request.
Unique number assigned by USAC to the consortium or individual entity that filed the request seeking funding for supported services.
Name of the HCP entity that filed the request seeking funding for supported services.
City where Filing HCP is located.
State where Filing HCP is located.
County where filing HCP is located
Zip code where Filing HCP is located.
System-generated latitude for Filing HCP’s physical address.
System-generated longitude for Filing HCP’s physical address.
Unique number assigned by USAC to the Participating HCP receiving services.

domain_metadata.value: This data set contains information collected from the FCC Forms 462, 466 and 466A which includes basic information about the applicant and service provider, information regarding the type of service requested, the funding start and end dates and information about the total committed amount and total disbursed amount.  All data contained within the FCC Forms 462 (Funding Request Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF) program), 466 (Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program), 466A (Internet Service Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program)  is self-reported by applicants to the Rural Health Care (RHC) program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: Basic Information (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains data from the basic information section of each FCC Form 471, including applicant details such as contact information, applicant type, Billed Entity Number (BEN), student count, dollars, and category of service, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_name: Total Funding Year Pre-Discount Eligible Amount
Service Provider Filed by Billed Entity
columns_description: Discount rate applied to Voice services for the applicant on FCC Form 471 application. This discount is separate from the one applied to Data Transmission and/or Internet Access Services.
Name of the applicant's organization.
Applicant city
Applicant zip code extension.
First name of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471
Email Address of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471.
Last name of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Address line 2 of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
City of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
State of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Exact date and time (EST) when the form was certified.

Discount rate applied to Category Two services for the applicant on the FCC Form 471 application. Services discounted by this rate include Internal Connections, Managed Internal Broadband Services (MIBS) and/or Basic Maintenance of Internal Connections.
Total Funding Year Pre-Discount Eligible Amount
Funding request amount for applicant across all FRNs.

Nickname given to an FCC Form 471 by an applicant.

Longitude of the applicant.
Indicates whether the application has been certified during the FCC Form 471 application filing window.
Middle initial of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Applicant type including school, school district, library, library system, or consortium.
Indicates whether a service provider listed on any of the FCC Forms 471 assisted the Form's Billed Entity in locating funds needed to pay non-discounted share.
Current status of the FCC Form 471. It can be used to filter the following statuses: Certified and Committed.
Percentage of NSLP (National School Lunch Program) students for the school or school district.
Applicant state.
Unique application number generated at the time an applicant begins to file the FCC Form 471 application. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Title of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Zip code extension of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Phone extension of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.
Applicant email address.
E-Rate Billed Entity Number for the FCC Form 471 applicant.
Middle initial of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471
Address line 1 of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Email address of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Total eligible National School Lunch Program (NSLP) students. It can be used to filter applications submitted by the total eligible NSLP.

Discount rate applied to Category One services for the applicant on the FCC Form 471 application. Services discounted by this rate include Internet Access Services and / or Data Transmission but do not include Voice Services.
Time/date stamp of when the application was last modified.
Latitude of the applicant.
First name of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Zip code extension of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 471.
Link to download the original submitted FCC Form 471 as a PDF.
Applicant phone number.
10-digit number that the FCC assigns to a business or individual that registers with the FCC.
Last name of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471
Phone number of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471
Phone number extension of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471
Number of fulltime student enrollment.
Total amount necessary for the applicant to pay the non-discount share of eligible and any ineligible amounts

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains data from the basic information section of each FCC Form 471, including applicant details such as contact information, applicant type, Billed Entity Number (BEN), student count, dollars, and category of service, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What is the applicant entity’s student count? What will the category of service funding be used for? What is the contact information of the applicant?  All information within the Basic Information (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: E-Rate Recipient Details And Commitments
resource.description: This dataset combines key fields captured from the E-Rate Form 471 (Basic Information, FRN Status, FRN Line Items, Recipients Of Service, and Supplemental Entity Information).

domain_metadata.value: This dataset combines key fields captured from the E-Rate Form 471 (Basic Information, FRN Status, FRN Line Items, Recipients Of Service, and Supplemental Entity Information). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: Who are all the recipients in the E-rate program? What type of service is a particular recipient getting? How much is a recipient paying for a particular services? Who is the service provider for a particular recipient? Is the recipient a Tribal School/Library, Public School/Library, Charter School, etc?

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: E-Rate Supplemental Entity Information
resource.description: This dataset contains E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC) information about schools, libraries, school districts, library systems, consortia, and non-instructional facilities (NIFs). For Annexes information, please refer to the "E-Rate Supplemental Entity Information: Annexes" dataset.
columns_name: ESA School District with no Schools
Does this organization have an endowment?
Main Library Branch School District Name
Main Library Branch School District Number
columns_description: An institution that temporarily houses students from a school which is considered the "main entity" or original location of the student population.
A school that offers instruction to students drawn from other schools, and student counts can change throughout the year.
A Pre-K school.

The status of the FCC Form 498 submitted for the entity. Every service provider is required to have a 498 ID in order to participate in any universal service program and/or receive payments from USAC.

An Educational State Agency (ESA) comprised entirely of non-instructional facilities (NIFs), from which its staff is based. It may run education programs in facilities that are not recognized as elementary or secondary schools. Classifying such an entity as a school in EPC is necessary to be able to enter the total student count for all of its member school districts.
Indicates if the library system consists exclusively of private libraries.
An established ESA serving as a consortium leader, aggregating demand and assisting in bulk purchases on behalf of some or all of the school districts and/or libraries in its service area.
A school operated by an Educational Service Agency to provide specialized services such as Vocational or Special Education.
Indicates if the library is a research library.
A facility with a comprehensive child development program that serves preschool-age children and their families.
A NIF which is (and should be) labeled as a school in EPC, but usually has within it a primary or secondary education program.
Indicates if the library has not been fully constructed.
General Contact of the entity.

An E-Rate applicant may self-identify as a Tribal entity in their EPC entity profile if the majority of library patrons served are Tribal members; the entity is located partially or entirely on Tribal land; or the entity is a library operated by a Tribal Nation.
Indicates if the library is the main branch of the library system in which it is located. Main branch will also be listed as “Yes” for independent libraries.
LEA code for the school district.

An E-Rate applicant may self-identify as a Tribal entity in their EPC entity profile if the majority of students served are Tribal members; the entity is located partially or entirely on Tribal land; the entity is a school operated by or receiving funding from the Bureau of Indian Education (BIE); or the entity is a school by a Tribal Nation.
User-entered urban/rural status for the entity.
Indicates the school’s alternative discount method such as sibling match, survey, or combination (not CEP).
Indicates if the library is public.
Indicates if school district is a public school district.
A facility that is treated in the same way as a juvenile justice facility.
The number of the parent entity.
State of the entity’s mailing address.

Total interior area of the library measured in square footage.
Code assigned by NCES for private schools.
A dormitory for housing students.
The peak number of part-time students for the school.
This field is blank if the entity does not have a parent. If an entity has more than one parent, the entity is listed multiple times.
Unique number assigned to the form by USAC for an Applicant FCC Form 498.
Additional address information if applicable.
Additional address information if applicable.

Code assigned by the Institute for Museum and Library Services (IMLS) that identifies the population density of the library’s location. Libraries that are located in the IMLS locale code of 11-City, Large; 12-City, Midsize; or 21-Suburb are eligible for a higher pre-discount budget than libraries with other locale codes.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC) information about schools, libraries, school districts, library systems, consortia, and non-instructional facilities (NIFs). For data about annexes, please reference the data set titled “E-Rate Annex Information”.  The data set is updated nightly and includes the latest updates to EPC entity profiles as of 9 p.m. ET from the previous day. Parent and child relationships are included in the data set for each entity. If a given entity has more than one parent (e.g., an entity that is a member of two consortia) the entity will be listed multiple times. The data set includes a field for entity status which indicates whether the entity is active or closed.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% - 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that applicants left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: FRN Line Items (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the FRN line items within each FCC Form 471, including individual product/service data, costs, quantities, and descriptions.
columns_name: Support Connection to school, library or NIF
Direct Connection to school, library or NIF
FRN Line Monthly Eligible Recurring Costs
FRN Line Monthly Recurring eligible unit Cost
FRN Line One-Time Eligible Unit Cost
FRN Line One-Time Ineligible Unit Costs
FRN Line Monthly Recurring Ineligible Cost

Manufacturer not included in the drop down list.
FRN service maximum burstable speed.
Additional information about the FRN line item service or product.  Examples include: routers, switches, copper, fiber, wireless, cabling/connectors, and racks.
Unique funding request number associated with the FCC Form 471.
Number of buildings/sites that will use the connections listed in this FRN line item. Options include all buildings/sites listed; one building/site listed; or multiple buildings/sites listed.
Indicates whether the equipment installation is included in the price.
Indicator whether the service provider provides a connection between eligible Schools, Libraries, and NIFs (i.e., a connection that provides a wide area network (WAN)).
Funding year for the application.
Upload speed units ( Mbps or Gbps) for the FRN line item service.
Burstable speed unit ( Mbps or Gbps) for FRN line item.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.
Indicates if the service provider provides basic firewall protection as a standard component of the Internet access for the FRN line item.
Indicates whether the equipment has been leased or has a non-purchase agreement for internal connection.
Indicates whether the application has been certified in the window.
Indicates whether the service provider provides internet service directly to the School, Library or NIF or if it uses an Internet circuit to a district hub to connect.
Upload speed for the FRN line item service.
Internet download speed unit (e.g. Mbps or Gbps) for FRN line item.
Applicant state.
Download speed of the connection for the FRN line item service.
Pre-discounted eligible monthly charges for the FRN line item.
Total eligible costs for the funding year prior to applying a discount for the FRN line item.
Model  of the equipment on FRN Line Item. It can be used to filter FRN Line items of a particular model.
Manufacturer for the FRN line item product.
Quantity for the one-time costs for the FRN line item.
Applicant organization name.

Service purpose for the FRN Line Item. It can be used to filter the records of a particular type of purpose.  There are five purposes: Backbone circuit for consortium that provides connectivity between aggregation points or other non-user facilities; Data Connection between two or more sites entirely within the applicant’s network; Data connection(s) for an applicant’s hub site to an Internet Service Provider or state/regional network where Internet access service is billed separately; and Internet access service with no circuit (data circuit to ISP state/regional network is billed separately).
Email Address of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471.
Total monthly eligible costs for the FRN line item.
Funding request line item number can be used to filter the records associated to a specific FRN line item
Product or service type for the FRN line Item.  Examples include: ATM, data plan for portable device, OC-1, connectors, DS-4, and frame relay.
Units of product or service for the FRN line item.  Examples include: each, dozen, per foot, per hundred feet, or hours.
Number of months during the funding year for the FRN line item service.
Total pre-discounted eligible recurring charges for the FRN line item.
Unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Unique billed entity number associated with the entity name on the FCC Form 471 application.

Total rediscount eligible one-time charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN line item level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN  level.
Total one-time eligible costs for the FRN line item.
Total one-time ineligible costs for the FRN line item.
Pre-discounted non-recurring charges for the FRN line item.
Number of units for the FRN line item monthly recurring costs.
Total monthly ineligible costs for the FRN line item.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the FRN line items within each FCC Form 471, including individual product/service data, costs, quantities, and descriptions.   Use this dataset can answer questions about the individual products or services used by the applicant for their broadband connectivity, the cost of individual products or services, and the quantity of individual products that are funded by E-Rate.   All FCC Form 471 information contained within the FRN Line Items dataset is self-reported by E-Rate applicants.  USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: Connectivity Information (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This collection contains connectivity data about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471, including service type, contract information, service provider data, and cost for the service, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_name: Child Entity's Form 471 Upload Speed Unit Name

columns_description: Aggregate Internet Access for the Entire District.
Internet upload speed for a parent entity. This information needs to be seen in context of the corresponding speed unit.
Internet download speed reported for a parent entity. This information needs to be seen in context of the corresponding speed unit.
Internet download speed reported for the child entity. This information needs to be seen in context of the corresponding speed unit.
Connectivity barriers for a robust network for a child entity e.g. Equipment too costly, Outdated equipment, Physical structure or layout of building etc.
Internet upload speed reported for the child entity. This information needs to be seen in context of the corresponding speed unit.

Descriptive information about the barrier when an applicant selects "Other" among the pre-populated connectivity barrier options available on the FCC Form 471 application.
Connectivity barriers for a robust network for a parent entity (e.g. Equipment too costly, Outdated equipment, Physical structure or layout of building etc.).
Email Address of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471.
Applicant's state.
Unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Entity number for a child entity.
Connection type for a child entity (e.g. Dark Fiber, Wireless data service, Broadband Over Power Lines etc.)
Applicant's Organization Name.
Upload speed units (Mbps or Gbps) for the parent entity.
Indicates whether the application has been certified in the window.
Billed entity number for applicant.
Internet download speed unit for the parent entity (e.g. Mbps or Gbps).
Internet upload speed unit for the child entity (e.g. Mbps or Gbps).
Wi-Fi quality/sufficiency for the child entity e.g. Completely, Mostly, Sometimes etc.
Funding year for the application.
Connection type for a parent entity (e.g. Dark Fiber, Wireless data service, Broadband Over Power Lines etc.).

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.
Internet download speed unit for the child entity (e.g. Mbps or Gbps).
Wi-Fi quality/sufficiency for the parent entity (e.g. Completely, Mostly, Sometimes etc.).

domain_metadata.value: This collection contains connectivity data about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471, including service type, contract information, service provider data, and cost for the service, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What are the individual service types? What quantity of service did the applicant request? Which service provider is supplying service and what is the length of the contract? What discount did the applicant receive on services? Did the applicant request funding for fiber? All information within the Connectivity Information (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.
